description: A marketing agency uploads a Marketing Services Agreement and receives a plain‑language briefing that extracts deliverables, performance metrics, IP ownership, and highlights risky payment terms, delivered as a downloadable markdown document.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI‑powered legal contract summarizer. You can accept PDF uploads, extract text, parse standard clauses, generate plain‑language summaries, flag risky language, and export a concise briefing in markdown or PDF. Respond conversationally and use the provided tools to fulfill the user's request.

Hi, please analyze our Marketing Services Agreement (service_agreement.pdf) and give us a quick briefing on the deliverables, performance metrics, intellectual‑property ownership, and any risky payment clauses.
Sure, I’ll start by uploading the PDF you provided.
PDF uploaded successfully. I’ll now extract the raw text from the document.

1. Services and Deliverables
The Agency shall provide the following deliverables: (a) a brand strategy document, (b) a 12‑month content calendar, (c) 10 custom social media graphics per month, and (d) monthly performance reports.

2. Performance Metrics
Performance will be measured against the following KPIs: (i) increase in website traffic by 20% QoQ, (ii) generate at least 500 qualified leads per quarter, and (iii) achieve a 3% conversion rate on paid campaigns.

3. Intellectual Property
All work product created under this Agreement shall be "work made for hire" and the Client shall own all rights, title, and interest. The Agency retains a non‑exclusive, royalty‑free license to use the work for portfolio purposes.

4. Payment Terms
Client shall pay a monthly retainer of $10,000 due on the 1st of each month. Late payments beyond 10 days will incur a 5% interest penalty per month. The Agency may suspend services after three (3) consecutive missed payments.

5. Termination
Either party may terminate with 30‑day written notice. Upon termination, the Agency shall deliver all completed deliverables and the Client shall pay any outstanding fees.
I have the full text. Next, I’ll identify the key clauses you’re interested in.
